awd_titl_txt: ROW:  Defining Kinematic Stability Fields for Shear-Sense         Indicators
awd_abstract_narration: Many structural geometries used to determine the sense of                  shear in deformation zones are not well understood and cannot be                used to obtain shear strain magnitudes.  A computer code will be                developed to quantify the relative importance of rigid objects and              foliations to the development of shear zone fabrics.  The code will             simulate shearing deformation using a range of kinematic variables.             At each stage of the project the model predictions will be compared             with naturally deformed sheared rocks from well-constrained sites.              The results will help clarify the relationships among many                      structures developed in shear zones and identify practical criteria             for estimating shear-strain magnitude in rocks.  These findings                 will be of practical value to structural geologists working in a                great numbers of different tectonic environments.
